result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe L Rios

defendant.name: Rios, Joe L
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
addressed to: Joe L Rios for hearing on 9/15/22
 No longer in custody

8:36 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Joe L Rios.   Court inquires how the matters will be proceeding.  Atty. McClure provides an update; he is requesting a further proceedings date in November.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in November.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:49 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Joe L Rios.  Atty. McClure provides an update; he needs additional time to discuss the offer with his client and figure out where the case is headed.  Atty. McClure also notes his client has asked that bail be addresses and is not sure if that can occur today.  State is asking that a formal motion be filed and another hearing date set to address bail.  Atty. McClure requests a date this week if possible.  Court notes if the matter is set for this week Atty. McClure will need to file a formal motion to modify bail by the end of business day today, 09/12/2022.  Court will adjourn for bail hearing this week.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joe L Rios
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-12-2022)
Prior: 706 Arcadian Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

9:18 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Joe L Rios.  Atty. McClure provides an update, he believes there may be new charges coming but has not received anything formal yet.  Atty. McClure advises he needs additional time to review both of the current cases and is not ready to resolve the matters yet.  Atty. McClure also notes he would like to have the matter set for a bail modification hearing soon.  Court will only entertain a bail modification once a formal motion is filed.  Atty. McClure requests the matter be set over for further proceedings in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

10:54 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a WCS non-compliance letter was filed on 5/18/22, but notes a compliance letter was filed on 6/9/2022 so things are back on track.  Atty. McClure provides an update and believes the matter will resolve.  Court notes it will set the matter for further proceedings at this time but if counsel files a plea questionnaire and wants to proceed to plea and sentencing sooner they can contact the clerk's office.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Woodman's listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:06 PM Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J McClure.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and the Court reasds complaint to the defendant.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
